He showed us the ranch with his cow herding Sheppard. Who went straight to showing off how good a dog he was by herding cows for us. He also showed us his many beautiful horses and burros. Now I come from an equestrian family, 5 generations of horse breeders. And wow right off the bat I was impressed with his horsed. He had a buckskin-dun. I have never seen one. Basically people this is one of true horses of the old West. Next the house. It was big and clean
3 bedrooms and 2 very large showers which after a few hotels stays I am seriously grateful. Now on the listing it says no wifi or TV. He had both there. The wifi was fine for us (simple internet and emailing) TV had 12 channels I swear were better than DirecTV. Kitchen had everything you need and its large. Lots of towels and anything else you need. We slept in the back bedroom the bed was too firm for me but I like super soft beds. But if anyone is like my husband they will love that bed so a heads up on who get the big bedroom. Now this is something I rarely come by in Airbnb. He had to have one of the best washer and dryers I have ever had at an airbnb. It has all the bells and whistles and he even had everything you need for it. So if you want a true western stay I would highly recommend this ranch. We loved it. PS the sunsets and mountains are beautiful there.

I stayed here for a month, originally was suppose to stay for my entire 3 month contract but decided after being here for about a week or so to find different housing. She had everything you could possibly need in the hideout . My only problem is , not much privacy . I didn’t realize she lived next door (not that I wanted to party or anything ) also, when I first arrived , which was two days earlier, (she told me to let her know if i came earlier ), she accomodated me. But she kept asking about my payment of the two prior days , which made me feel a lil uncomfortable . On my profile , i mentioned it would be two guests. Apparently she didn’t see that and when I arrived with my fiancé , she quickly said in a passive aggressive tone“ is he staying , I didn’t realize you had a guest “ , That was the first incident that made us feel unwelcoming .Also , the next day or so , we locked the bottom lock instead of using the keyless entry (by mistake) , called Mandy to unlock the door, and she couldn’t find the key, her husband Bill came over very agitated and upset and wasn’t very friendly might I add ,which was appalling to me because that was my very first encounter with him and he didn’t even introduce himself as such . Just made us feel very uncomfortable . That was the reason I chose to find a different rental . Overall it’s a nice place to stay for a little while, but when the heat turns up in New Mexico, the hideaway can be very hot and the air conditioner don’t really cool the place off. I worked nights and couldn’t really sleep in the day due to the heat in the rental . I must admit, after the door incident she did email to check on us and also Bill became a little more friendly .

The kitchen area has a small living area that holds a 2 person sofa, coffee table, floor lamp and a wall mounted television. The television is on cable and has many channels. The wifi/internet has a strong signal and never gave me any problems. The air conditioning kept the unit very comfortable during hot days. The washer and dryer are located in a room between the two rentals and worked perfectly. Entry into the unit is via keypad. There is a rear patio that has table with chairs and a barbecue.
The owners, Mandy and Bill, were very friendly and were quick to help. They live next door but leave you alone so your stay is private.
We recommend this unit for 1 or 2 people and would return for another visit.
